intro: Aulacospermum alatum, commonly known as the winged thistle, is a flowering plant native to southern Africa. It is characterized by its spiny, upright stems and leaves that are often covered in fine, hair-like structures. The plant produces yellow flowers that bloom in late summer, attracting pollinators such as bees and butterflies. Its unique wing-like structures on the stems give it a distinctive appearance. Aulacospermum alatum is adapted to arid environments and is often found in rocky or sandy soils.
